O jogo tem um visual e ambientação muito legal, bem dark, e desperta muito a sensação de nostalgia de Diablo 2. Dito isso, o jogo não é para mim. Achei o sistema de skills zuado e desnecessariamente complexo (você tem que achar joias para criar ou melhorar as skills, e só ganha pontos passivos ao evoluir, numa teia de opções complexas). A dificuldade também é um ponto contra (eu jogo para me divertir, não passar nervoso ou ter que ficar desperdiçando horas em busca do build perfeito. Detesto jogos souls like). E por fim as classes são bem desbalanceadas (umas vão performar melhor que outras). Enfim, não recomendo, mas por não ser algo que me divirta jogando. Vamos ver como vai ser quando o jogo lançar por inteiro (mas o sistema de skills ainda vai ser um forte ponto contra)

Review as a POE newcomer that bounced of POE1 years and years ago Ranged combat feels really good at the moment. Sorc, Merc, Ranger, all feel really satisfying with WASD movement. Melee combat feels worse than POE1 because movement speed is basically a rarity, no QS flask so you're stuck rolling on boots (will complain about gear later) stun threshold is punishing as fuck, and animations are way too slow. Monk feels decent but only because his skills launch him around the screen so you might as well be ranged. Maybe new weapon types fix this but I doubt it. Shield is mandatory for warrior and I think that's bad because weapon switching feels AWFULLLLL swap speed should NOT be a attribute that's dumb as fuck Campaign is good for act 1/2. Act 3 sucks right now because the maps are way too big. You can easily get lost in an act 3 map looking for the exit for 50 minutes. That's just absurd and they need to tune it way way down especially if they're going to be adding more acts to the game in full release. Leveling every league is gonna be complete shit if they keep expanding maps in later acts Passive tree needs more useful nodes on the bottom half. The top and right side of the passive tree are the only parts that feel good at all. Armor, max life, and evasion (kinda) suck so much. If you aren't focusing on energy shields you're literally trolling. 6k life you get 1 shot by white mobs. It's insane??? New skill gem system is so much better its insane. I really prefer it to POE1 in every way. Sockets, links, and gem drops was just an unnecessary headache and they fixed it. Endgame stinks. I never mapped in POE1 so I can't actually speak on it in comparison. My character is the most powerful it has ever been and yet the game is specifically designed to kill that feeling. One life per map is so punishing I cannot believe they chose to do this. So many things one shot you in POE2 (even white mobs! on-death effects!!!!) that you are forced to run maps like a survival horror game. I genuinely couldnt imagine running juiced maps with a titan warrior??? If they gave you a few lives, even 2, I could understand. You go buck wild and risky for your first life and if you die you have to slow down and take the map really carefully. As it stands, you just have to creep along, shitting out skills off screen, and if you kill a mob pack you have to literally run away and wait a few seconds before looting. It feels bad!!! the maps themselves are not good. why are so many so so so so narrow??? There are a lot of times you're on a narrow walkway and a white mob throws bombs down and you literally cannot escape. GG your map is toast. the map design feels at odds with the combat design. Loot isnt good! once you're running maps you're just flipping Magic Find rings and amulets for Exalts so you can go buy your actual upgrades on poe2trade. Uniques are almost all bad, and the rolls on them seems weighted terribly?? Why am I level 82 rolling a unique for like 13 energy shield?? Most rares are pretty bad/useless and crafting basically doesn’t exist. There are like 5 good attributes out of the 10000000 options so using currency to roll items feels like a heavily slanted game out of your favor. I’d rather do sports betting. You’re just better off trading for literally everything in the game. The more I play the more issues i have with it. I think it will take more than 12 months of EA to fix it. I still keep playing though so it’s like a 6/10.

I honestly can't say either I recommend nor not recommend this game with how it is. The single most reviewed part of the game is the enemy AI and how broken it is. I spent 3 hours trying, retrying, using 10+ different loadouts, and different tactics and I still can't even get half of a single mission finished solo because the AI is that broken. They will perfectly target unarmored spots on you bringing up the question of it even worth using armor, will completely shrug off shotgun shells and high caliber rounds on unarmored areas especially the head and arms, and instantly target you making 180 turns the second they're in YOUR fov. The threaten command is also flawed in the fact that it doesn't work half the time. Calling out to civs resulting in them never complying and actually actively walking away until you start shooting at them which shouldn't be the case, armed suspects will do the same if they aren't instant aggro on you pumping you full of 2 mags of headshots. Killing armed suspects shouldn't even penalize you when the entire point is that they are ARMED, they are active THREATS to you, they won't even be surrendering and you'll get penalized over attacking them because there is the precognition of being a THREAT wielding firearms against you. Blah blah blah cry about skill issue, these are straight up glaring issues with the game that you can't even deny exist and get in the way of the quality of the game. I think the devs NEED to improve the AI to not be so blatantly broken and flawed. All of the non-lethal loadout options outside of the grenades are also completely ineffective and don't provide any benefit, maybe if you could shoot guns out of peoples' hands and not get penalized for it they would be better namely the beanbag shotgun or the pellet guns actually affecting the target without wasting a full mag to get the effect to work as intended.

Tldr: Good but rather flawed. It's pretty good at what it does. I love the looks in general and the sound design is great. Much gear to try out and many weapons to fiddle with. But it's still rough around the edges and I think you need to spend too much time testing for yourself what works and not, because nothing is really explained and you are left to just assume things. AI teammates are somewhat clunky and stupid, and sometimes they don't follow your commands but you won't know why. The commands also lacks flexibility. But when they work as intended it's pretty awesome. Enemy/civilian AI is... I don't know. Mostly they snipe you from some corner of a window with their uzis. You scream at them, you shoot near them, you shoot them, sometimes they react, sometimes they don't. Sometimes they go incapacitated, sometime they die outright. You taser them and shoot them with beanbags or pepper balls. They might surrender.. maybe. Or they just stand there looking at you for a while first. Supposedly the enemy AI is very complex but that doesn't really show. (yes I have S-grade in some levels, I know what works but that took some major experimenting) There are several other minor issues I've noticed; like the replays don't always save, some keybindings reset every time I close the game, items counters don't add correct value when managing your gear, subtitles are misspelled or using the wrong words (in english), making a headshot sometimes makes the target go bald and change his face preset... Small stuff, but it adds up. Get it on a 50% sale. At the moment I don't think it's worth the full price. I still like it, especially when playing coop with my friends and there are no AI teammates. But in all honesty, it needs some fixin'. 6,5/10

I find it actually very cool the developers of this game put in very touchy subjects like school shootings or full on meth houses no one likes school shootings we all know that but its actually a great way to connect you to what an actual school shooting is like if you dont react quick enough you can slowly hear the other remaining students being shot by the shooters and yes its terrifying but its real at some times almost to real but thats ready or not so are you ready?

This is not just a review but a warning to new players. Ready or Not randomly deletes your progress & game-saves. This issue is known since at least 2023 & it hit me in 6 hours. I am an experienced SWAT player with friends & family that all played those old SWAT titles and we were looking for a new one. I bought it - customized the four SWAT NPCs - you can save the layout & already this was glitchy as suddenly a layout-file was gone (I saved a second ago). Then I played three missions. All with an A+ rating (means I unlocked to 100% cosmetic gear/rewards). But in the 4th mission an arrest glitch happened (you could not arrest an NPC, what is a glitch that can happen- okay for me); I retried - failed, then I stopped, ended the game. But as I restarted the game later - my entire career file was gone, all rewards locked again & while trying to find a fix (loaded MP, load into a New Career) I googled and found Reddit posts & articles that second my experience. Some said it happened to them later in the career, so it seems to be random. I asked for a refund – but Steam goes: "You exceeded 2 hours & if the game does not save the progress this is no problem..." This is why I put this up here, so that you do not gift Steam & the developer money for a product that might come with the worse gaming havoc at random. As it does not matter how random or rare the problem is: To write & read a file (a save) should be not a problem in the year 2024/2025 or something a player should worry about. Nobody can want this. I can't even imagine that all devs are fine with this. The game remembered my prior mission-rating (it pops up if you start a new career). Means: It was able to store this information while locking me out from my rewards that came with this mission rating & deleted all saves (gear-layout for NPCs & player/career-progress etc.) for reasons unknown. I only recommend this game to players who do not care about career/customization (unlocking items & such stuff) but want to play a different MP game once in a while with no progress attached. The game-play etc. is all great. I was going to tell everyone: "It's like old SWAT go & buy it." Now I will go: "Don't! As it can be that we have to play Mission 01 20 times to get to Mission 07, without sending save-game files over the net. At least in SP this can happen to you anytime." Stuff you had to deal with 20 years ago & no Steam. At least know that this can happen. As if I would have known this beforehand I would have never bought this game. I feel ripped off as I donate a lot & have a very small gaming-budget while being a 'veteran'gamer (& modder for multiple titles). Ripped off by a police-game on Steam.^^ What irony. That's why the bad guys shoot at the SWAT teams! They want to protect the money! - Happened to me once, too!^^ I bought this game on Steam; and after I asked for a refund as it deleted the saved files randomly - guess what happened!^^ You have been warned.
